answerText: "Out, Out-"[10] "Out, Out" was written by this American poet who also wrote "Nothing Gold Can Stay," "The Death of the Hired Man," and "Stopping by Woods on a Snowy Evening."
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Yale B + Bellarmine  | 19 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: At the end of this poem people "turned to their affairs" because they "were not the one dead." For 10 points each: [10] Name this poem about a boy who dies after his hand is severed by a buzz-saw, based on the true story of Raymond Fitzgerald.
